I formerly used a lot of JUnit 3.x, now I start to really use JUnit 4.

In JUnit 3 there was a runBare() method which could be overwritten. There I had access to the method TestCase#getName() which returns the name of the test, something like "testMe".

For JUnit 4 I wrote a class which extends org.junit.runners.Suite. There I can do some stuff I can do in the runBare() method of JUnit 3. I won't confuse you too much, since I have a lot of questions concerning runBare() migration from JUnit 3 to 4.

But the ugliest question now I have is this: In case of a exception I want to call a method which captures the screenshot (UI tests). The file name must contain the test case name which failed. In JUnit 3 I would simple use TestCase#getName() in the run bare method. But how do I do this with JUnit 4? Please don't look too much on the letters but on my intention. How to get the name of the test method which is currently executed in the test runner?
